clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomized, Placebo Controlled Study to Determine the Efficacy and Speed of a Nasal Spray in Allergen Induced Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Four-Way Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo Controlled Study to Determine the Efficacy and Speed of Azelastine Nasal Spray and Antihistaminic Agents in Adult Subjects With Allergen Induced Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis

brief_summary.textblock: Finding out how fast azelastine nasal spray works in subjects with hay fever.

primary_outcome.measure: Onset of action measured by change in total nasal symptom score Until "Onset of action" = until drug demonstrates and maintains a change greater than placebo compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline for individual symptoms of allergic seasonal rhinitis; overall assessment of efficacy

intervention.description: One Astelin spray per nostril plus one placebo tablet. In Cross-Over-Design with other arms.
One placebo spray per nostril plus one Loratadine 10 mg tablet. In Cross-Over-Design with other arms.
One placebo spray per nostril plus one 10 mg Cetirizine tablet. In Cross-Over-Design with other arms.
One placebo spray per nostril plus one placebo tablet. In Cross-Over-Design with other arms.
